Key Arguments: The legislation represents foreign interference and threatens a free and democratic society.
There is skepticism about the government's ability to determine truth, questioning who makes these decisions and why.
Science relies on debate and diverse opinions, and the legislation could suppress this by imposing the views of a financially powerful minority.
The bill contradicts the principles of a free democratic society and violates Article 19 of the Declaration of Human Rights.
The legislation could further divide society and create an environment of fear and threat.
The bill is seen as part of a global power grab by non-elected foreign bodies like the WHO and WEF.
Censorship infringes on freedom of speech and human rights.
Notable Quotes: This is an attempt from foreign interference to stop a free and democratic society from existing.
Science is about debate and doubt and opposite opinions to be real science.
You may not silence people because they have a different opinion to a government body, it is out of order and it goes against the declaration of human rights, article 19.
Censorship on freedom of speech is a serious breech of human rights.
